page.title: 19ASCOT RESIDENT INTERVIEW.
page.content:
We interviewed an{elderly lady}who has been living on the{Bouldish Farm} {Estate, South Ascot}for twenty-seven years. She lives alone in a two-storey block of{flats}occupied mainly by retired couples. Her accommodation is rented from the {Council}and includes a living room, a bedroom, a bathroom, a kitchenette and a small hall. She furnished the flat herself and pays for the lighting and heating. The Council is responsible for basic repairs and redecoration.
{Living alone}is difficult for elderly people here, because there is no local Doctor or Dentist and no Community Hall. The{shops}with more choice of goods are in Ascot, a bus ride away, and the{bus service}is infrequent. The Mobile Library calls once a week.
